definition: to plead/to claim as an excuse
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: His excuse about the train being late doesn't ring true to me.
sentences.chinese: 他推说是火车误点了，这话听来不真实。

sentences.english: Elizabeth shrugs it off as campaign jitters.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白推说是竞选活动引起的紧张不安。

sentences.english: Zheng Baosheng complained that the atmosphere there was not suitable for him to perform properly.
sentences.chinese: 张宝胜推说是现场气氛不好，影响功力发挥。

sentences.english: Wang's wife answered the door and announced that her husband was not at borne.
sentences.chinese: 王常盈的妻子应声把门打开，推说她的男人不在家。

sentences.english: Lin Wu Yang composure, say oneself just to come for congratulations.
sentences.chinese: 林午阳表现镇静，推说自己只是前来道贺。

sentences.english: I pleaded fatigue, and excused myself.
He replied that lines of longitude don't cross the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 他推说这条经线没有经过海洋。

definition: to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to use all sorts of excuses
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to tactfully decline/to turn down gracefully
